SUMMARY: Fucose regulator, FucR, acts as an activator of operons involved in fucose transport and degradation [3325779]. During induction by fuculose 1-phosphate, FucR binds to DNA, positively autoregulating itself and simultaneously activating transcription of the divergent fucAO operon. Expression of this operon requires growth on l-fucose or l-rhamnose under anaerobic conditions [3005235, 2834341]. The repressor gene of this operon is positioned at the 3? end of the operon itself [2664711]. As a member of the DeoR family, FucR features an N-terminal domain containing a putative helix-turn-helix motif [8955387].
